result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alvin J Sanapaw is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Alvin J Sanapaw was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Order of Discharge upon expiration of commitment

02:23 Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw appears and attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure appear via Zoom Video.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is in agreement with the proposal submitted by DOC. Atty. Campshure objects to residence location as defendant would like to live with family. Court swears in Wendy Stone. Atty. Campshure questions witness. No cross by State. Court approves conditional release plan as proposed.
Review hearing on July 29, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

11:40 AM Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Both appear by phone.  Bela Alexander Ballo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Conditional release plan discussion.  Remarks by case worker re: group home placement.  Questions by Atty. Campshure and Atty. Ballo.  Review hearing scheduled for July 29, 2020 at 02:15 pm.
Review hearing on June 29, 2020 at 11:15 am.

01:30 pm Conditional release hearing Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw appeared by zoom means. Prosecuting Atty Laura Nelson appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report of 4-15 reviewed.  
Doctor Taylor joins the hearing via zoom.  Questioned by ADA Nelson.  Questioned by Atty Campshure.  
Judge will authorize for conditional release planning.  
  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
Cover letter for Conditional Release Petition
Judge faxed copy requested to Mendota

2:00 p.m.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel Jeremy Campshure.  State appears by Catharine White.  Dr. Leslie Taylor is sworn and testifies for the State.  Court accepts witness as an expert and questioned by Attny White.  After review of more recent documents from Mendota the doctor has changed her mind on releasing defendant on community supervision.  Believes it will take a minimum of 6 months to restore stablilty through defendants medications.  Cross exam by Attny Campshure.  Redirect, recross, redirect.  No defense witnesses.  Brief arguments by DA White and Attny Campshure.  Court denies the conditional release request at this time on both defendant's files.
Order for Examination - NG by reason of mental disease

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Conditional release hearing.  Dr Taylor sworn in and testifies.  Questioned by ADA White.  Cross exam by Atty Campshure.  Judicial notice taken of reports.  State asks for denial of release.  Defense asks for court to grant release.  Court rules:  progress is insufficient to develop a plan for release.  Motion is denied.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with Attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court informs the parties the report has been reviewed. Both Atty.'s inform the court that they also have reviewed the report. Dr. Leslie Taylor sworn (via telephone) & questioned by Atty. White. Cross exam by Atty. Campshure. Atty. White provides  her closing statements to the court. Atty. Campshure provides his closing statements to the court. Ruling - Request is denied by the court.
Report from Mendota Social Worker Zehr
request from Jennifer Zehr for copy of Dr Taylor report - Judge Oked
order for examination (not guilty by reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Mendota requesting copy of Dr. Taylor's report.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is still pursuing his request for conditional release.  Dr. Taylor appears by phone and is sworn and testifies regarding her report.  Cross-exam.  Court questions Dr. about defendant's medications.  Arguments by parties.  Court denies request for conditional release at this time and signs the order.
letter from Judge to Dr Taylor
letter from defendant to Judge regarding mother's illness - Judge forward onto Attorney's
letter from defendant asking for conditional release - Judge forward to Attorney's

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Leslie T. appears by phone and testifies regarding her report.  Does not believe the defendant should have conditional release and explains why.  Court denies request for conditional release and continues placement at Mendota with involuntary administation of medications.
from Mendota on defendant's petition for conditional release
letter from defendant asking for conditional release - Judge forward to Attorney Groh

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody. Catharine White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MOTION TO WITHDRAW PLEA:  Atty Groh summarizes motion 1) DE was unaware of elements of charges 2) Court unable to cite factual basis.  ADA White calls Atty SW to testifiy.  SW addresses Court, only way he can testifiy is if DE gives permission.  DE permits testimony.  SW sworn & testifies.  Ex. 1-PLQ signed by DE.  Objection - Relevance-Sustained.  Cross-exam.  Objection - Counsel is testifying - sustained.  ADA White moves to admit Ex. 1. No objection, Atty Groh notes Ex. has previously been highlighted.  Court questions witness.  Atty Groh request recess to confirm w/client.  Recess 11:35 AM-11:38 AM.   DE sworn by Court and testifies.  Cross-exam.  Objection - Motion speaks for itself - sustained.  Cross-exam. Closing statements:  Atty Groh - re: part 1 of motion, requests DE be allowed to withdraw plea, part 2-cites case law.  ADA White - creditable testimony is that of SW, believes DE knew what he was doing at the time, requests Court deny motion.  Atty Groh -  specific claim - DE did not know the elements of burglary.  Court finds colique was deficient, Dr. Galli reviewed basis idea w/DE, reviews transcript of original plea hearing on record, finds DE was not lacking in knowing the elements, DENIES MOTION.  Atty Groh to draft order.
order of the COA that the time for filing the defendant's NOA or post-conviction motion is extended to 11-21-16
Defendant's Motion for Extension of Time (Court of Appeals)
to the SPD office with names of court reporters and dates of hearings

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is the date set to determine the amount of time defendant should be institutionalized.  DA requests 14 1/2 years.  Arguments by defense.  Court order 6 years with credit for 254 days concurrent with 15CF169.  Appeal rights.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steven Edward Weerts in court, defendant Alvin J Sanapaw  in court, in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report reviewed by State and the defense.  Sally Fleischmann Forensic supervisor sworn in and testifies.  Makes recommendation for Institutionalization.  Cross Exam by Atty Weerts.  Judge makes a finding that Atty Weerts pointing out in the statute.  Defendants father sworn in and testifies.  Both attorneys question Mr. Sanapaw.  Defendant addresses the court.  Attorneys each make arguments.  Judge finds recommendation of agency logical.  All standards are met.  Institutional Care and medical treatment required. No voting, no firearms.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report from Dr. Galli received (does not reference this case).  Atty Weerts believes this case is covered under the report, requests Court find NG due to Mental Disease or defect.  ADA White will stipulate to NGI plea.  Plea questionnaire filed w/NGI plea to Count 1.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  Advises DE of voting & firearms rights.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and find DE NGI.  ADA White moves to dismiss count 2, requests DE remain in custody.  Review hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Atty. Weerts will get a doctor to perform an evaluation.  Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Jesse S. sworn and testifies for the State.  Cross exam by Attny Weerts.  Re-direct by Attny Niemi.  Court questions witness.  Arguments as to bindover.  Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for arraignment.  Attny Weerts argues for a reduction in bond.  Based on prior record bond will not be modified.
Picture and prints.  No contact with DS or JS or property at N6921 Oak Park Rd in the Town of Wescott.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw appeared by video means with Atty Weerts.  Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Defendant has a case with Branch 1 already; therefore scheduling will be done with branch 1 off record.
